content:
@jenlampton, @klonos, @Graham Oliver, Graham has agreed to let me take over as maintainer of the Backdrop Gauth module. Can you give me write access?

backdrop-contrib/gauth
Allows for authentication with Google enabling use of Google APIs. - backdrop-contrib/gauth
@Graham Oliver can you please confirm the above?

@bugfolder can you please for the record point me to any discussion had with @Graham Oliver ? ...I don't see an issue in https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/gauth/issues for it.

backdrop-contrib/gauth
Allows for authentication with Google enabling use of Google APIs. - backdrop-contrib/gauth

...I've mentioned this in https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib/issues/113 so that we can have a record :wink:

Porting of Google Calendar API and Google Auth 路 Issue #113 路 backdrop-ops/contrib
I would like to be able to use the Google Calendar API from within Backdrop and I am proposing to try porting the GCal module. This needs the Google Auth (GAuth) module and I have made a start with...

@klonos we shoudn't ever grant maintainer access via chat. There needs to be a github issue, either in the modue's queue (if the current maintainer will grant access) or in the backdrop-contrib queue (if one of us needs to grant access)
@bugfolder If the project gauth is abandoned, the process for getting access is documented here: https://backdropcms.org/user-guide/adopt-a-project
@klonos maybe we should document the process for asking current maintainers for access too?
It looks like the readme for that file also needs to be updated, since there is no Backdrop maintainer listed. If there isn't one, then this project qualifies as abandoned.
My correspondence with Graham was via email (and I'd just emailed him again to confirm), but now that I see the issue is in the issue queue, he can respond there.
Thanks @bugfolder :+1:
@jenlampton , thanks for the adoption link; I've added it to my relevant-reference link collection.

Thanks @bugfolder, yes we need a public approval from the maintainer if there is one, but in this case it looks like there is not, so we don't need @Graham Oliver's approval. Though, it is nice of you to ask anyway :)
OK, i'll proceed with creating the "Maintainer change request" issue.

Right ...I saw Graham's name, but it was in a "Current porting to Backdrop" section - NOT current maintainer ...see: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/gauth#current-porting-to-backdrop

backdrop-contrib/gauth
Allows for authentication with Google enabling use of Google APIs. - backdrop-contrib/gauth
Who can approve if there's no current maintainer?
@Herb if there's no current maintainer then no approval is necessary.
